attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it is unfair, unjust, and contrary to the principles of democracy that the Scottish people look set to have a say on their independence and not the British people.

We want parliament to discuss holding (perhaps separate) votes in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, in addition to a Scottish vote on the issue. Given our heritage and economic interconnection, all British need a say, especially those living in other parts of the islands with Scottish links.
